intro: Tinus luzonensis, commonly known as the Luzon tinus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, elliptic leaves with a smooth texture. It produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
